seg-source.mrk: TIMESTAMP data type

target.mrk: TIMESTAMP data type

seg-source.mrk: TIMESTAMP data type

target.mrk: TIMESTAMP data type

trans-unit.source: TIMESTAMP stores a combined DATE and TIME value to be stored. It permits a fractional-seconds value of up to nine digits.

seg-source.mrk: TIMESTAMP stores a combined DATE and TIME value to be stored.
It permits a fractional-seconds value of up to nine digits.

target.mrk: TIMESTAMP stores a combined DATE and TIME value to be stored.
It permits a fractional-seconds value of up to nine digits.

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: TIMESTAMP

target.mrk: TIMESTAMP

seg-source.mrk: Corresponding compile-time Java type

target.mrk: Corresponding compile-time Java type

seg-source.mrk: java.sql.Timestamp

target.mrk: java.sql.Timestamp

seg-source.mrk: JDBC metadata type (java.sql.Types)

target.mrk: JDBC metadata type (java.sql.Types)

seg-source.mrk: TIMESTAMP

target.mrk: TIMESTAMP

trans-unit.source: Dates, times, and timestamps cannot be mixed with one another in expressions.

seg-source.mrk: Dates, times, and timestamps cannot be mixed with one another in expressions.

target.mrk: Dates, times, and timestamps cannot be mixed with one another in expressions.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the following formats for TIMESTAMP:

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the following formats for TIMESTAMP:

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the following formats for TIMESTAMP:

seg-source.mrk: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.nnnnnnnnn] yyyy-mm-dd-hh.mm.ss[.nnnnnnnnn]

target.mrk: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.nnnnnnnnn] yyyy-mm-dd-hh.mm.ss[.nnnnnnnnn]

trans-unit.source: The first of the two formats above is the java.sql.Timestamp format.

seg-source.mrk: The first of the two formats above is the java.sql.Timestamp format.

target.mrk: The first of the two formats above is the java.sql.Timestamp format.

trans-unit.source: The year must always have four digits. Months, days, and hours may have one or two digits. Minutes and seconds must have two digits. Nanoseconds, if present, may have between one and nine digits.

seg-source.mrk: The year must always have four digits.
Months, days, and hours may have one or two digits.
Minutes and seconds must have two digits.
Nanoseconds, if present, may have between one and nine digits.

target.mrk: The year must always have four digits.
Months, days, and hours may have one or two digits.
Minutes and seconds must have two digits.
Nanoseconds, if present, may have between one and nine digits.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server. If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server.
If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> also accepts strings in the locale specific datetime format, using the locale of the database server.
If there is an ambiguity, the built-in formats above take precedence.
